span.strong: Governor Murphy has announced that all New Jersey schools will remain closed through at least May 15th
Click here for the latest NHTS COVID-19 updates

strong.span: This year is the 50th anniversary of Earth Day, an annual event to demonstrate support for environmental protection. One small way that we can minimize our impact on the planet is by recycling - taking something old and turning it into something we can enjoy all over again.
We set our video to a great song called “Big Yellow Taxi,” written and originally performed by Joni Mitchell and “recycled” by Counting Crows.

span.a: Take a Look in a Book

div.span: The Staff at New Hanover Township School loves to read and share our favorite books with our friends at school. While we are separated, we are thinking of everyone and looking forward to the day when we will be able to share together the classic stories and rich literature that we have grown to love. Until then, take a look in a book and find that world of wonder that is waiting for you! We cannot wait to hear all about it!

span.span: With special thanks to "The Doodlebops" for creating the perfect song to accompany our show!

span.em: Click here to watch a video message from the teachers and staff at New Hanover Township School

strong.span: Click here to watch a message from Dr. Larkin

span.strong: The New Hanover Township School PTO will hold a virtual meeting Wednesday, April 29 at 6:30 pm. If you are interested in joining contact nhtspto@gmail.com

div.span: Click here for Public Notice of Meeting
Click here for Zoom Meeting Instructions

div.p:
New Hanover Township School District
122 Fort Dix St
Wrightstown, NJ 08562
Dr. Scott Larkin, Principal Dr. Richard Wiener, Superintendent
Dear New Hanover Township School Families:

This morning, the New Hanover Township School community began remote learning. While we recognize that this method of delivering instruction is neither traditional nor ideal, I want us to embrace our role in being socially responsible and a part of the solution in slowing the spread COVID-19.

Since March 5th, our staff has prepared for today by creating lessons, communicating with families, and sending materials home with students. The next few weeks will present evolving challenges, but no school community is better equipped to conquer these obstacles than we are. Together, as always, we will work to meet the needs of our students. If you have any questions during this time, please do not hesitate to contact me at any of the following:
Thank you all for your understanding during this difficult time.

Dr. Scott Larkin, Principal
New Hanover Township School

hr.p:
New Hanover Township School District
122 Fort Dix St
Wrightstown, NJ 08562
Dr. Scott Larkin, Principal Dr. Richard Wiener, Superintendent

Upon the recommendation of the Burlington County Health Department, on Monday, March 16, NHTS will move to a virtual/remote learning environment for all NHTS students. Please know that follow-up information will continue to be sent by Dr. Larkin via email, list serve and posted on the district and teacher webpages.

As of this writing, the closing of the building for students will occur through April 19, 2020 as recommended by the Burlington County Department of Health. The school district will continue to evaluate the length of the closure and follow guidelines provided by our public health officials. During this time, students who are eligible for free or reduced lunch will receive daily meal deliveries.

As of 8 PM today, March 13, all afterschool, evening, and weekend activities will be cancelled/rescheduled to a later date. All facility use events will also be cancelled. In addition, all clubs, theater/athletic practices, games and competitions will be cancelled until further notice.

Please be aware that this continuously changing health situation may require further adjustments. If public health officials provide additional guidance that changes their current recommendation, the district will provide further notice to the community.

We thank you for your ongoing flexibility and patience throughout this health situation as we all strive to prioritize the health and safety of our students and staff members. Thank you to our faculty and staff members for their continued professionalism and efforts throughout this ongoing challenge.
Dr. R. Wiener and Dr. S. Larkin
NHTS Remote Learning Team- Dr. Larkin, Mr. Bramley
NHTS Building/ Grounds- Sanitizing, Food Services, Transportation Team- Mr. Cavarello, Mr. Nelson
All NHTS teachers will be available daily beginning 3/16/2020

span.span: This year, NHTS will be offering after care to our families from the end of the school day until 6:00pm each day that NHTS is open, including half days. The program will cost $150/month or $10/day for students who will not attend every day per month. The school will provide snacks for students, but not transportation. Payment must be made to "New Hanover Township School District" by the beginning of each month. Arrangements can be made for families who need to use this service on an emergency basis. If you are interested in enrolling in the program, please contact the main office at (609) 723-2139 to complete the registration process.

p.span: Parent Toolkit is a one-stop resource developed with parents in mind, produced by NBC News Learn and supported by Pearson. It includes information about almost every aspect of your child’s development.

img.title: Accident Insurance Protection for Students

div.style: margin: 0in 0in 0pt; text-align: center; font-family: 'Times New Roman';

span.div: If you wish to pre-pay for your child's breakfast, lunch or snack, complete the payment form and return it with your check. Make checks payable to NHTS Board of Education. Please put your child's grade and name in the memo column of the check. If you do not want your child to purchase snacks with the money, please let us know that so we can mark it in the system.

div.a: Directions to check cafeteria account balances/purchases.

div.style: margin: 0in 0in 0pt; text-align: center; color: #ff0000; font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt;

div.em: The New Hanover Township School District creates a passion for the life-long learning in our community.
We foster productive, patriotic, respectful citizens in a safe, active environment.
Using National Standards, our quality instruction supports student achievement through academic excellence. We prepare our students to function, grow and thrive proudly in a global society.
